meanings.definition: The pulse or beating of the heart.
meanings.sent1: I felt my sphygmus quicken when I saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The doctor checked my sphygmus to monitor my heart rate.
meanings.sent3: My sphygmus danced with joy when I won the race.
meanings.sent4: The sphygmus of the city could be felt in the bustling streets.
meanings.sent5: Her sphygmus echoed loudly in the silent room.

meanings.definition: A measurement of blood pressure using a sphygmomanometer.
meanings.sent1: The nurse recorded my sphygmus with the blood pressure cuff.
meanings.sent2: The sphygmus reading was normal during the check-up.
meanings.sent3: The sphygmus measurement made me feel like a human machine.
meanings.sent4: His sphygmus reading was like a steady drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The sphygmus value was crucial for the diagnosis.

meanings.definition: The rhythmic expansion and contraction of an artery as blood is pumped through it.
meanings.sent1: I could feel the sphygmus in my wrist as my heart pumped.
meanings.sent2: The sphygmus in the artery was strong and steady.
meanings.sent3: The sphygmus in the garden hose mimicked a flowing river.
meanings.sent4: The sphygmus of life flows through our veins.
meanings.sent5: The sphygmus of the music matched the rhythm of my heart.
